docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 7--Latin America's fitful dream of economic unity comes under close analysis this week by the political leaders of the region's 240 million people.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 7--Latin America's fitful dream of economic unity comes under close analysis this week by the political leaders of the region's 240 million people.
docs.abstract: J de Onis article on econ factors in creation of common mkt; map; cites need to speed growth rate; notes that because of population rise of nearly 3% a yr, fastest in world, net gain in production of goods and services, '66, was just over 1%, compared with Alliance for Progress 2.5% minimum; revs obstacles, including vast difference between nations

headline.main: Latin-American Unity at Stake in Market Decision; U.S. URGING CHIEFS TO PULL TOGETHER A Trade Area Is Viewed by Some Nations as Ideal but Others Fear Integration

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 10 President Johnson asked Congress today for a joint resolution to delay a threatened nationwide railroad strike for 20 days. Approval was expected tomorrow.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 10 President Johnson asked Congress today for a joint resolution to delay a threatened nationwide railroad strike for 20 days. Approval was expected tomorrow.
docs.abstract: talks resume; Fitzsimmons charges lockout is 'labor-busting shutdown' aimed at winning new antistrike legis; Trucking Employers announces steps to continue movement of essential mil goods

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, April 10 Strict security measures were imposed in Punta del Este today. With most of the hemisphere's chiefs of state gathering here tomorrow, the soldiers and secret service agents of all their nations have made things so...
docs.lead_paragraph: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, April 10 Strict security measures were imposed in Punta del Este today. With most of the hemisphere's chiefs of state gathering here tomorrow, the soldiers and secret service agents of all their nations have made things so tight that a person without a badge and identity papers can be arrested on the shot.
docs.abstract: tight security precautions at Punta del Este described

headline.main: SECURITY IS TIGHT IN PUNTA DEL ESTE; U.S. and Paraguay Provide Most Secret Service Men

byline.original: By BARNARD L. COLLIER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The last meeting of the Presidents of the American republics took place in Panama in July, 1956, to commemorate the 130th anniversary of the first pan-American conference. President Eisenhower attended that meeting, which was largely ceremonial.
docs.lead_paragraph: The last meeting of the Presidents of the American republics took place in Panama in July, 1956, to commemorate the 130th anniversary of the first pan-American conference. President Eisenhower attended that meeting, which was largely ceremonial.

headline.main: Americas' Presidents Met Last 11 Year's Ago

docs.snippet: Pres-elect Somoza (Nicaragua) will not attend because of bro's illness; outgoing Pres Guerrero to attend

docs.lead_paragraph: NACHABHUAZU, Bolivia, April 10 I have just returned from a four-day jungle patrol with the First Battalion, Fourth Division, of the Bolivian Army, which discovered a strongly fortified base of Castro-type Communist guerrillas deep in the Bolivian jungle.

headline.main: BOLIVIA UNCOVERS BIG JUNGLE CAMP; Trip to Base Is Described Fortified Area Called Red Guerrillas' Bastion Bolivia Uncovers Jungle Camp Said to Be Red Guerrillas' Base

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 10 President Johnson left tonight for Punta del Este, Uruguay, for a three-day conference with 17 other American heads of government, the first such  meeting since 1956.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 10 President Johnson left tonight for Punta del Este, Uruguay, for a three-day conference with 17 other American heads of government, the first such meeting since 1956.
